DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Post-Operative Platelet Normal Result Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether the postoperative absolute granulocyte count and platelet count are within the criteria set by the protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Post-Operative Platelet Normal Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the result of a medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood following a surgical procedure for platelets, irregular, disc-shaped fragments of large bone marrow cells called megakaryocytes in the blood that assists in blood clotting, being approximately within certain limits.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: Post-Operative; relating to or occurring during the period immediately following a surgical operation.:platelet. An irregularly shaped disklike cytoplasmic fragment of a megakaryocyte that is shed in the marrow sinus and subsequently found in the peripheral blood where it functions in clotting. A platelet contains granules in the central part (granulomere) and, peripherally, clear protoplasm (hyalomere), but no definite nucleus; is about one-third to one-half the size of an erythrocyte; and contains no hemoglobin. (STED98):Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm. (NCI):Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: Post-Operative; relating to or occurring during the period immediately following a surgical operation.
An irregular, disc-shaped element in the blood that assists in blood clotting. Platelets are not blood cells, they are fragments of large bone marrow cells called megakaryocytes.
Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results or effects (does not include CTC Adverse Events) of therapeutic agents or procedures administered to the patient.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Are the postoperative absolut
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are the postoperative absolute granulocyte count and platelet count within the criteria set by the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text22
ReferenceDocuments.description: Were the other malignancies limited to one or more of the following: carcinoma in situ of the cervix, colorectal carcinoma in situ, melanoma in situ, and basal cell and squamous cell carcinoma of the skin
